data.title: Kishore Kumar's Death Anniversary: From 'Mere Sapno Ki Rani' to 'Roop Tera Mastana', revisiting his greatest hits
data.meta_description: On Kishore Kumar's death anniversary today, 13 October, let's remember the legend and take a look at some of the iconic songs by the legendary singer
data.text:
Years have passed, but the legacy of legendary singer Kishore Kumar is still alive. The maestro’s contribution to music in Bollywood is unparalleled. Till date, Kishore Kumar is considered one of the finest playback singers Indian cinema has ever got. His versatility in singing in different languages also touched hearts of millions.

Advertisement

Over his illustrious career spanning decades, Kishore Kumar earned several accolades, including many Filmfare Awards for Best Male Playback Singer. The ace singer also donned the actor’s cape in iconic films like Naukri (1954), Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi (1958), Padosan (1968) among others.

On Kishore Kumar’s death anniversary today, 13 October, let’s remember the legend and take a look at some of his iconic songs:

Mere Sapno Ki Rani

Mere Sapno Ki Rani is an all-time favourite song from the 1969 film, Aradhana, starring Rajesh Khanna and Sharmila Tagore. A celebrated romantic melody depicts a young man’s admiration for his dream woman. The catchy tune clubbed with Kishore Kumar’s voice made the song an instant hit among fans.

Advertisement

Zindagi Ek Safar Hai Suhana

Zindagi Ek Safar Hai Suhana is a beautiful creation picturised on superstar Rajesh Khanna. With this song, Kishore Kumar indeed emoted deep emotions among his followers. This song from the 1971 film, Andaz, continues to inspire listeners with its profound message.

Roop Tera Mastana

Another Kishore Kumar hit from Aradhana , which is cherished by people of all age groups, is Roop Tera Mastana. The song’s peppy rhythm makes it grab one of the top spots in playlists of people even today.

Advertisement

Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas

A soul-stirring song Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas exemplifies Kishore Kumar ability as an extraordinary singer. Its heartfelt lyrics paired with soothing music proved it to be a timeless track. Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas is undoubtedly a classic from the golden era of Bollywood.

Yeh Shaam Mastani

Advertisement

A song from the 1971 film Kati Patang, Yeh Shaam Mastani is a soulful rendition that keeps on enchanting listeners and evokes feelings of nostalgia as well as romance.
